content.question:
Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

A survey conducted by a national research center asked a random sample of <math alttext="920" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>920</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> teenagers in the United States how often they use a video streaming service. From the sample, <math alttext="59%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>59</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> answered that they use a video streaming service every day.

(a) Construct and interpret a <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confidence interval for the proportion of all teenagers in the United States who would respond that they use a video streaming service every day.

frqParts.text:
Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

A survey conducted by a national research center asked a random sample of <math alttext="920" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>920</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> teenagers in the United States how often they use a video streaming service. From the sample, <math alttext="59%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>59</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> answered that they use a video streaming service every day.

(a) Construct and interpret a <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confidence interval for the proportion of all teenagers in the United States who would respond that they use a video streaming service every day.

(b) Based on the confidence interval in part (a), do the sample data provide convincing statistical evidence that the proportion of all teenagers in the United States who would respond that they use a video streaming service every day is not <math alttext="0.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>? Justify your answer.

topic.text: 6.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Proportion

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate inference method for confidence intervals.
